recipes.name: Layered Tropical Smoothies
ingredients: 1 large frozen banana, chopped into 1-inch chunks
2 tablespoons freeze-dried strawberries (optional, for added flavor)
directions: Step 1: To prepare the strawberry smoothie, combine the chopped banana, hulled strawberries, Greek yogurt, freeze-dried strawberries, and honey in a blender. Blend until smooth, about 30 seconds.
Step 2: For the mango smoothie, blend the frozen chopped mango and cream of coconut in a blender until smooth, about 30 seconds.
Step 3: To make the coconut smoothie, combine coconut sorbet and pineapple juice in a blender. Blend until smooth, about 30 seconds.
Step 4: Layer the smoothies in glasses as desired to create a tropical mix, or serve each smoothie separately.

Use natural, diffused sunlight to enhance the smooth textures and create soft shadows. Style with a rustic wooden backdrop and a light linen napkin. Garnish with fresh mint leaves and a sprinkle of freeze-dried strawberries on top. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to emphasize the layers, with a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background, drawing focus to the smoothie. Aim for a bright, refreshing mood.

recipes.name: Peanut Butter and Chia Jelly Cacao Smoothie
ingredients: 2 cups almond milk (or milk of your choice)
1/4 cup smooth peanut butter, plus extra for smearing
4 pitted Medjool dates, or 6 dried dates soaked in boiling water for 5 minutes
A few whole berries, for garnish
For the chia jelly: 1/2 cup frozen raspberries, thawed; 1 tablespoon chia seeds; 1 tablespoon maple syrup
directions: 1. In a bowl, combine thawed frozen raspberries with chia seeds and maple syrup. Mash the berries with a fork until slightly chunky and well mixed.
2. Set the chia jelly mixture aside to thicken for at least 15 minutes. For best results, prepare and refrigerate the jelly for 1-2 hours.
3. In a blender, combine the almond milk, ripe bananas, cacao powder, peanut butter, Medjool dates, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt.
4. Blend the smoothie ingredients until smooth and creamy.
5. Smear some peanut butter on the inside walls of a glass. Add half of the prepared chia jelly to the glass and swirl it around.
6. Pour the smoothie into the glass over the chia jelly, and top with whole berries, chopped peanuts, and cacao nibs as desired.

recipes.name: Chocolate Mango Smoothie
ingredients: 2 cups frozen mango chunks, peeled and cubed
½ medium-sized sweet potato, cooked and mashed
A pinch of freshly ground black pepper
directions: Step 1: Add the frozen mango chunks, cooked sweet potato, almond yogurt, grated ginger, turmeric powder, black pepper, and vanilla extract into a blender.
Step 2: Blend on high until smooth and creamy. If the mixture is too thick, add a small amount of water to help it blend.
Step 3: Pour half of the smoothie mixture into serving glasses.
Step 4: Add the cocoa powder to the remaining smoothie in the blender, then pulse until fully mixed.
Step 5: Gently pour the chocolate smoothie over the mango layers in the glasses and swirl gently with a straw.
Step 6: Serve immediately, topped with crushed almonds if desired.

recipes.name: Chocolate Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 2 large frozen bananas, cut into pieces
1/3 cup (80 ml) almond milk or milk of your choice
8 pitted dates, soaked in warm water for 10 minutes if dried
1-2 tablespoons honey or maple syrup, to taste
1 nectarine, cut into thin wedges, for topping
1 handful of mixed berries, for topping
20 grams dark chocolate, melted, for drizzling
directions: 1. Cut the frozen bananas into pieces and place them in a plastic freezer bag or container. Freeze for at least 5 hours or overnight.
2. Before making the smoothie, remove the bananas from the freezer and let them rest for 5-10 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, melt the dark chocolate in the microwave or over a hot-water bath until smooth.
4. In a blender, combine the frozen bananas and almond milk. Blend until smooth.
5. Add the cocoa powder, soaked dates, honey (or maple syrup), and protein powder (if using) to the blender. Blend for an additional 1-2 minutes or until completely smooth.
6. Divide the smoothie between two bowls and top with the nectarine wedges, kiwi slices, and mixed berries.
7. Drizzle the melted chocolate over the smoothie bowls and add a dollop of Greek yogurt on top. Optionally, decorate with additional banana slices.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy!

recipes.name: Super Green Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 1/4 ripe avocado, halved and flesh scooped out
2 medium ripe bananas, sliced and frozen
1 cup fresh or frozen mixed berries (organic when possible), strawberries or raspberries for a greener smoothie, darker berries for a purple smoothie
2 large handfuls fresh spinach (organic when possible), washed and stems removed
1 small handful fresh kale (organic when possible), washed and large stems removed
1.5 to 2 cups unsweetened non-dairy milk, adjusted based on berry consistency
Optional: 2 tablespoons salted creamy almond or peanut butter
Roasted unsalted sunflower seeds for topping
Raw or roasted nuts (e.g., almonds, pecans, walnuts) for topping
directions: Step 1: Combine the avocado, frozen bananas, mixed berries, spinach, kale, non-dairy milk, and flaxseed meal in a blender.
Step 2: Blend until creamy and smooth. If the mixture is too thick, gradually add more non-dairy milk or water to reach your desired consistency.
Step 3: Taste the smoothie and adjust sweetness or flavor by adding more ripe banana or a splash of maple syrup.
Step 4: For a vibrant green smoothie, use strawberries; for a purple smoothie bowl, opt for blueberries or blackberries.
Step 5: To increase protein content, add nut butter; this will also enhance the natural sweetness.
Step 6: Divide the smoothie evenly between two serving bowls.
Step 7: Top each bowl with your choice of sunflower seeds, granola, nuts, shredded coconut, fresh berries, and hemp seeds.
Step 8: Enjoy immediately for the best flavor and texture. Leftovers can be stored in jars in the refrigerator for up to 1-2 days.

recipes.name: Super Green Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 2 medium ripe bananas, sliced and frozen
1 cup fresh or frozen mixed berries, preferably organic
2 large handfuls fresh spinach, preferably organic, stems removed
1 small handful kale, preferably organic, stems removed
1.5 to 2 cups unsweetened non-dairy milk, such as almond or oat milk
2 tablespoons salted creamy almond or peanut butter (optional)
Roasted unsalted sunflower seeds, for topping
Raw or roasted nuts, such as almonds, pecans, or walnuts, for topping
directions: Step 1: Place all smoothie ingredients - avocado, frozen bananas, mixed berries, spinach, kale, non-dairy milk, flaxseed meal, and almond or peanut butter (if using) - into a blender.
Step 2: Blend on high speed until creamy and smooth. If the mixture is too thick, add more non-dairy milk or water to reach the desired consistency.
Step 3: Taste the smoothie and adjust the flavor as needed. Add more banana or maple syrup for sweetness, more spinach for a greener hue, or more non-dairy milk for creaminess.
Step 4: To achieve a greener smoothie bowl, use strawberries; for a purple bowl, opt for darker berries like raspberries or blueberries.
Step 5: If desired, stir in nut butter for extra protein and to enhance the natural sweetness of the smoothie.
Step 6: Divide the smoothie mixture evenly between two serving bowls. Adjust the division if making a larger batch.
Step 7: Top the smoothie bowls with your choice of toppings - sunflower seeds, granola, nuts, shredded coconut, fresh berries, and hemp seeds.
Step 8: Serve immediately for the best flavor and texture. Leftovers can be stored in jars in the refrigerator for up to 1-2 days.

directions: Step 1: Add the nut milk (or dairy milk), spinach, frozen banana, chopped apple, and avocado to a blender.

recipes.name: Refreshing Watermelon Smoothie
ingredients: 1 medium seedless watermelon, cut into 1/2 inch cubes
1 cup almond milk (or soy milk or whole milk)
directions: Step 1: Gather all the ingredients needed for the smoothie.
Step 2: Cut the seedless watermelon into 1/2 inch cubes, reserving two small wedges with rind for garnish.
Step 3: Line a cookie sheet with waxed paper. Spread the watermelon cubes in a single layer, leaving space between pieces. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze for 1 hour.
Step 4: For advanced preparation, after freezing, transfer the watermelon cubes into plastic storage bags, keeping them in 3-cup portions for later use.
Step 5: Once you have 3 cups of frozen watermelon, place them in a blender. Add the almond milk, vanilla yogurt, and maple syrup.
Step 6: Blend the mixture until it reaches a smooth consistency.
Step 7: Pour the smoothie into chilled glasses. Garnish each glass with a wedge of watermelon and a sprig of fresh mint, if desired.

recipes.name: Acai Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: ¼ cup almond milk, or as needed to thin
directions: Step 1: In a blender, combine 2 frozen Sambazon acai smoothie packs, ½ sliced banana, and ¼ cup almond milk, then blend until thick and smooth.
Step 2: Scoop the smoothie mixture into a bowl and freeze until ready to add toppings.

recipes.name: Refreshing Green Smoothie Popsicles
directions: Step 1: In a food processor, combine the frozen raspberries, frozen red currants, 1/4 cup water, and chia seeds. Blend until the mixture is smooth.
Step 2: Pour the raspberry mixture into popsicle molds, filling them about halfway. Place the molds upright in the freezer for about 10 minutes to set slightly.
Step 3: In the same food processor, add the banana, apple, orange, kiwi, pineapple, dried dates, passion fruit, flax seeds, sesame seeds, and 3/4 cup water. Blend until completely smooth.
Step 4: Carefully fill the molds with the green smoothie mixture, leaving a little space at the top. Insert popsicle sticks and return the molds to the freezer.
Step 5: Freeze the popsicles for at least 2-3 hours until solid.

Use bright, natural light to accentuate the popsicles' rich colors and textures, showcasing the fresh fruit inside. Employ a shallow depth of field to create a soft background that highlights the popsicles as the focal point, evoking a refreshing and playful summertime mood.

recipes.name: Ginger Pear Green Smoothie
ingredients: 2 large ripe pears, quartered and cored (about 1 pound)
2 ripe bananas, peeled and cut into quarters
8 stalks lacinato kale, stems removed (approximately 4 ounces)
1 small piece of fresh ginger, peeled and roughly chopped (about 1 inch x 1 inch or ½ ounce)
½ to 1 cup water (optional, to thin the smoothie)
directions: Step 1: Quarter and core the ripe pears and add them to the blender.
Step 2: Peel the bananas and cut them into quarters before adding to the blender.
Step 3: Remove the stems from the lacinato kale and add the kale leaves to the blender along with the chopped ginger and the kombucha.
Step 4: Blend the mixture, starting on low speed and gradually increasing to high, until completely smooth, approximately 1 minute.
Step 5: If desired, add water gradually to achieve your preferred smoothie consistency and blend again.
Step 6: Pour the smoothie into containers and enjoy immediately.
Step 7: If you need to store the smoothie, place it in the refrigerator, but consume within the same day for optimal flavor.

Use natural light to emphasize the smoothie’s creamy texture, casting soft shadows. Style the scene with a rustic wooden table, a linen napkin, and fresh ginger and pear slices nearby as props. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to enhance the smoothie’s height, using a shallow depth of field to blur the background, creating a fresh and inviting mood.

recipes.name: Ginger Pear Green Smoothie

recipes.name: Cranberry Mango Layered Smoothie

1/2 cup Almond Breeze Almondmilk Cashewmilk Blend

1/4 cup Almond Breeze Almondmilk Cashewmilk Blend
Sweetener to taste (such as honey or agave syrup)
Optional: Chia seeds, flax seeds, ground flax, or hemp seeds
directions: Step 1: Blend the spinach, frozen mango, Almondmilk Cashewmilk Blend, and orange juice in your blender until smooth.
Step 2: Pour the green smoothie mixture into a glass or two small cups and place it in the freezer to chill.
Step 3: Rinse the blender, then blend the cranberries, frozen raspberries or strawberries, Almondmilk Cashewmilk Blend, orange juice, and sweetener until smooth.
Step 4: Pour the cranberry layer into a separate glass and also place it in the freezer for about 10 minutes.
Step 5: After chilling, gently spoon the cranberry smoothie on top of the green smoothie for a layered effect.

recipes.name: Aloha Tropical Smoothie
ingredients: 4-5 cups water, for cooking tapioca pearls
½ cup large tapioca pearls, dried
2 tablespoons water, for mixing with tapioca
2 tablespoons pure maple syrup, for sweetening tapioca
1 cup fresh strawberries, cleaned and hulled
1 tablespoon pure maple syrup, optional for additional sweetness
1 cup unsweetened coconut milk, for blending
1 cup fresh orange or pineapple juice, unsweetened (unsweetened almond milk can be used for a lower sugar option)
Pineapple wedges, whole strawberries, or shredded coconut, for garnish (optional)
directions: 1. Cook the tapioca pearls according to the package directions. Once cooked, drain the pearls and place them in a small container.
2. Mix the tapioca pearls with 2 tablespoons of water and 2 tablespoons of maple syrup. Refrigerate until needed.
3. In a small food processor or blender, puree the cleaned strawberries with the optional tablespoon of maple syrup until smooth. Set aside.
4. In a blender, combine the frozen bananas, frozen mango chunks, fresh pineapple, coconut milk, and fresh orange or pineapple juice. Blend until smooth and creamy.
5. If using the tapioca pearls, distribute them evenly between 2-3 glasses. Add a spoonful of strawberry puree on top of the pearls, then pour the smoothie mixture over it.
6. When the glasses are approximately three-quarters full, add more strawberry puree, then finish filling with the remaining smoothie mixture.
7. Garnish each glass with fresh pineapple wedges, a whole strawberry, or shredded coconut as desired.

recipes.name: Carrot Ginger Turmeric Smoothie
ingredients: 2 cups (approximately 275 g) carrots, peeled and chopped
1 large ripe banana, peeled, sliced and frozen (additional banana for sweetness, optional)
1 cup (140 g) frozen or fresh pineapple, chopped
1/2 tablespoon fresh ginger, peeled and minced
1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric (or substitute with ground cinnamon)
directions: Step 1: Prepare carrot juice by adding the chopped carrots and filtered water to a high-speed blender. Blend on high until the mixture is completely pureed and smooth, adding more water if necessary and scraping down the sides as needed.

Step 2: Line a mixing bowl with a large, thin dish towel. Pour the pureed mixture over the towel, then gather the corners and twist to squeeze out the juice until all liquid is extracted. Set aside the remaining pulp for use in smoothies or baked goods such as carrot muffins.
Step 3: Transfer the freshly extracted carrot juice to a mason jar. It can be stored for several days, although it is best when consumed fresh.

Step 4: In the same blender, add the carrot juice along with the remaining smoothie ingredients (banana, pineapple, ginger, turmeric, lemon juice, and almond milk). Blend on high until the mixture is creamy and smooth, adding more carrot juice or almond milk as needed to achieve the desired consistency.
Step 5: Taste the smoothie and adjust flavors as desired, adding more banana or pineapple for sweetness, more lemon juice for acidity, or more ginger for added bite.
Step 6: Divide the smoothie between two glasses and serve immediately for the best flavor.

recipes.name: Carrot Ginger Turmeric Smoothie
ingredients: 1 large ripe banana, peeled, sliced, and frozen
1 cup fresh or frozen pineapple chunks
1/2 tablespoon fresh ginger, peeled and minced
directions: Step 1: In a high-speed blender, add the chopped carrots and filtered water. Blend on high until the mixture is completely pureed and smooth, adding more water if necessary to assist with blending and scraping down the sides as needed.

Step 2: Place a large, thin dish towel over a mixing bowl. Pour the carrot juice over the towel, then lift the corners of the towel to twist and squeeze the juice out until all the liquid is extracted. Reserve any pulp for smoothies or baked goods.
Step 3: Transfer the extracted carrot juice to a mason jar and store it in the refrigerator. It will keep for several days, but it is best when used fresh.

Step 4: Add the carrot juice, banana, pineapple, ginger, turmeric, lemon juice, and almond milk to the blender. Blend on high until the mixture is creamy and smooth, adding more carrot juice or almond milk if needed. Scrape down the sides as required during blending.
Step 5: Taste the smoothie and adjust the flavors as needed by incorporating more banana or pineapple for sweetness, lemon juice for acidity, ginger for spiciness, or turmeric for warmth.
Step 6: Pour the smoothie into two glasses (adjust if necessary) and serve immediately for the best taste and texture.
